page.title: 16Village School, Littleworth
page.content: Opposite the Retreat Inn is a small building which used to be Norton village school. It was built in 1800 for children aged five to ten years old. Originally there were two small classrooms and a hallway which was later converted to make an extra classroom. For the last fiften or more years the building has not been used because a new Junior school has been built down the road at Littleworth. The new school is controlled by the Church and has thirty eight pupils aged five to nine years old. After nine, the children must travel to Drakes Broughton Middle School. Children at Littlewoth School come from the village, Norton and Hatfield. There are few city children. Locals hope the size of the school will grow as there are new houses being built.
